sen.j: 蘇我 韓子（そがの からこ、生年未詳 - 465年5月 (旧暦)）は、古墳時代の豪族。
sen.e: SOGA no Karako (date of birth unknown, died in May, 465) was a member of one of the local ruling families in the Kofun period.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』によると、蘇我韓子は、465年3月 (旧暦)、雄略天皇の命で紀小弓、大伴談、小鹿火宿禰とともに大将に任じられる。
sen.e: According to "The Chronicles of Japan," in March 465 (of the old calendar), SOGA no Karako was assigned as a General by the Emperor Yuryaku along with KI no Oyumi, OTOMO no Katari and OKAI no Sukune.

sen.j: 同月、新羅が百済地域に進出して城を奪い対馬海域を押さえる。
sen.e: In the same month, Silla (a Kingdom of Korea) invaded Baekje (another Kingdom of Korea) and seized its castle and the seas around Tsushima Island.

sen.j: そして、倭国と高句麗との交易を妨害しはじめたことに対し、新羅征伐のために朝鮮半島へ渡った。
sen.e: As Silla started interfering in trade between Wakoku (Japan) and Goguryeo (a Kingdom of Korea), SOGA no Karako went over to the Korean Peninsula to conquer Silla.

sen.j: 代わりにやってきたのが、小弓の息子紀大磐である。
sen.e: KI no Oiwa, son of Oyumi, joined the battle as the successor of Oyumi. However, he dominated OKAI no Sukune's troops as Oiwa wanted to inherit more than just his father's troops. That resulted in conflicts between Oiwa and Sukune.

sen.e: However, Oiwa was not satisfied with only inheriting his father's troops and so he dominated OKAI no Sukune's troops as well as ship soldiers which led Oiwa and Okai to have conflicts with each other.

sen.e: On the way to the border, when Oiwa was letting his horse drink water by the river, Karako shot an arrow at him from behind.

sen.j: しかし矢は大磐の馬の鞍に当たり、とっさに大磐が射返したところ、その矢が当たった韓子は落馬して河でおぼれ死んだ、とされる。
sen.e: It is believed that Karako, who missed Oiwa by hitting the saddle of his horse, was then shot by Oiwa and later drowned in the river after falling from his horse.
